statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Charlotte 83, Wofford 62
article.story: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) -- E.J. Drayton scored 17 points in the second half as Charlotte overcame a slow start to beat Wofford 83-62 on Sunday. Drayton finished with 20 points, tying his season high, for the 49ers (6-6), who overcame a 10-point deficit early in the first half to win their third straight. De'Angelo Alexander added 14 points and 11 rebounds, and three other Charlotte players also scored in double figures. Leemire Goldwire had 16 points, Courtney Williams 12 and Ian Andersen 11 for the 49ers, who won by their biggest margin this season. Shane Nichols scored 23 points and Drew Gibson added 17 points for the Terriers (4-9), who lost their eighth straight despite opening strong against Charlotte. Wofford had not played in 11 days. Wofford hit five of its first seven shots, all 3-pointers, while the 49ers missed five of their first seven as the Terriers went up 15-5 on Drew Gibson's 3 with 15:50 left. But Charlotte clawed its way back to take its first lead at 27-26 on Alexander's layup with 5:47 left. A jumper and layup by Nichols put Wofford back ahead, but Charlotte tied the score twice before Goldwire's layup with 1:11 left put the 49ers up 35-33 at the break. The two sides tied the score three times and swapped the lead six times in the opening minutes of the second half, with the Terriers going ahead for the last time at 49-48 on a pair of Gibson free throws with 14:11 left. Goldwire's 3-pointer from the corner 21 seconds left put the 49ers back on top, and ignited a 24-6 run that put the game away for Charlotte. Wofford, which has played nine of its last 10 games on the road, went more than 12 minutes without a field goal during the 49ers' run, which put them up 72-55 with less that 4:30 to play. After Matt O'Connor's jumper broke the Terriers' drought with 4:13 left, Charlotte went on a 7-0 run to take its biggest lead of the game, going ahead 79-57 on Alexander's free throw with 1:33 remaining.
